Our bipartisan legislation will: 
 
- Provide grants to support partnerships between schools and workforce development partners
- Helps support individuals who are unemployed
- Provide supports such as housing, health care, career counseling, and child care

html: Decades ago, our Vietnam Veterans were called to serve, leaving loved ones and putting their lives at risk for our country. But upon their return, our nation did not express the gratitude they deserved. Today is Vietnam War Veterans Day, let's ensure that we do. Thank you.
text:
Decades ago, our Vietnam Veterans were called to serve, leaving loved ones and putting their lives at risk for our country. But upon their return, our nation did not express the gratitude they deserved. Today is Vietnam War Veterans Day, let's ensure that we do.
 
Thank you.

html: Our bill would: - Close a loophole that encourages for-profit colleges to target veterans - Ensure that institutions are preparing students for good-paying jobs - Strengthen protections for student loan borrowers who have been defrauded or cheated
text:
Our bill would:
   
 - Close a loophole that encourages for-profit colleges to target veterans 
 - Ensure that institutions are preparing students for good-paying jobs
 - Strengthen protections for student loan borrowers who have been defrauded or cheated

html: Too often, shady for-profit colleges prey on students and veterans and do not give them the quality education they deserve. Today, @SenatorDurbin and I are introducing the #PROTECTstudents Act to help stop these practices.

html: President Trump is proposing to: - slash $845 billion from Medicare (which he said he would not do) - cut and cap Medicaid and end Medicaid expansion - cut other important funding to combat the opioid crisis, including gutting the Office of National Drug Control Policy
text:
President Trump is proposing to:

- slash $845 billion from Medicare (which he said he would not do)
- cut and cap Medicaid and end Medicaid expansion
- cut other important funding to combat the opioid crisis, including gutting the Office of National Drug Control Policy

html: The Senate just passed a bipartisan bill with critical NH priorities that @SenatorShaheen and I pushed for: - Permanently reauthorizes the Land and Water Conservation Fund - Enhances efforts to conserve the Nashua River - Designates Saint-Gaudens a National Historic Park
text:
The Senate just passed a bipartisan bill with critical NH priorities that @SenatorShaheen and I pushed for:
 
- Permanently reauthorizes the Land and Water Conservation Fund
- Enhances efforts to conserve the Nashua River
- Designates Saint-Gaudens a National Historic Park

html: Members of our armed services who earned Medals of Honor or were held as prisoners of war deserve a full military honors burial ceremony -- regardless of their rank. I've joined @SenTomCotton and @SenWarren in introducing bipartisan legislation to ensure that they do.

html: According to a new nonpartisan report, as a result of the senseless government shutdown: - The economy lost $11 billion ($3 billion that won't be recovered) - An untold number of businesses lost revenue We cannot afford another shutdown.
text:
According to a new nonpartisan report, as a result of the senseless government shutdown: 
   
 - The economy lost $11 billion ($3 billion that won't be recovered) 
 - An untold number of businesses lost revenue 
   
We cannot afford another shutdown.

html: My full statement on the deeply disappointing confirmation of Judge Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court:pic.twitter.com/GSymyLGb1b
text: My full statement on the deeply disappointing confirmation of Judge Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court:pic.twitter.com/GSymyLGb1b

html: Judge Kavanaugh is the antithesis of the impartial arbiter that a Supreme Court Justice must be, and the American people deserve far better.
text: Judge Kavanaugh is the antithesis of the impartial arbiter that a Supreme Court Justice must be, and the American people deserve far better.

html: There are many ways to corroborate allegations of sexual assault. We need to send a clear message to survivors that you deserve the opportunity to pursue justice and we will support you. Don’t let anything you’ve seen over the past weeks make you doubt that. 8/8
text: There are many ways to corroborate allegations of sexual assault. We need to send a clear message to survivors that you deserve the opportunity to pursue justice and we will support you. Don’t let anything you’ve seen over the past weeks make you doubt that. 8/8

html: But the way my colleagues have been speaking about “corroborating evidence” has potential dangerous implications far beyond the nomination of Judge Kavanaugh. I believe survivors. I also believe in the critical importance of due process. 7/
text: But the way my colleagues have been speaking about “corroborating evidence” has potential dangerous implications far beyond the nomination of Judge Kavanaugh. I believe survivors. I also believe in the critical importance of due process. 7/

html: The question of whether Judge Kavanaugh should be confirmed was not about whether allegations of sexual assault met a certain legal standard of evidence. It was about whether he had earned a lifetime appointment to the highest court in the land. 6/
text: The question of whether Judge Kavanaugh should be confirmed was not about whether allegations of sexual assault met a certain legal standard of evidence. It was about whether he had earned a lifetime appointment to the highest court in the land. 6/

html: Which brings me back to the definition of “corroborating evidence.” We cannot go back to the old standards where if there were no eyewitness nor DNA evidence, a survivor could not pursue justice. 5/
text: Which brings me back to the definition of “corroborating evidence.” We cannot go back to the old standards where if there were no eyewitness nor DNA evidence, a survivor could not pursue justice. 5/

html: No good attorney who could review the FBI’s reopened background investigation of Judge Kavanaugh would say it was a serious investigation to get the truth. There are simply too many potential leads the FBI was not allowed to follow. 4/
text: No good attorney who could review the FBI’s reopened background investigation of Judge Kavanaugh would say it was a serious investigation to get the truth. There are simply too many potential leads the FBI was not allowed to follow. 4/

html: My colleagues have argued that the FBI investigation of Judge Kavanaugh was comprehensive because they were allowed to interview the people who could’ve possibly been an eyewitness to the alleged sexual assault. I reviewed the report and that’s wrong. 3/
text: My colleagues have argued that the FBI investigation of Judge Kavanaugh was comprehensive because they were allowed to interview the people who could’ve possibly been an eyewitness to the alleged sexual assault. I reviewed the report and that’s wrong. 3/

html: It’s very rare in cases of sexual assault to have an eyewitness. It's also rare to have DNA evidence for many reasons – including that the vast majority of sexual assaults are not reported to the police. But those are not the only ways to get the truth. 2/
text: It’s very rare in cases of sexual assault to have an eyewitness. It's also rare to have DNA evidence for many reasons – including that the vast majority of sexual assaults are not reported to the police. But those are not the only ways to get the truth. 2/

html: As a Senator – and an attorney – I’ve been deeply concerned by how some of my colleagues have been defining “corroborating evidence” when it comes to cases of sexual assault. I know this is technical and it may seem insignificant. But it’s not, it’s critical. Here's a thread 1/
text: As a Senator – and an attorney – I’ve been deeply concerned by how some of my colleagues have been defining “corroborating evidence” when it comes to cases of sexual assault. I know this is technical and it may seem insignificant. But it’s not, it’s critical. Here's a thread 1/

html: For survivors of sexual assault, know that you are not alone. These last few weeks have been difficult for many. If you need to talk to someone you can call the National Sexual Assault Line at 1 (800) 656-4673 or visit https://www.rainn.org/
text: For survivors of sexual assault, know that you are not alone. These last few weeks have been difficult for many. If you need to talk to someone you can call the National Sexual Assault Line at 1 (800) 656-4673 or visit https://www.rainn.org/

html: When it comes to hacking and cyberattacks, anyone can be a target, and our country is at risk. html: According to the @CFPB 43 million Americans have overdue medical debt on their credit reports and our commonsense bill would prevent medical debt from continuing to damage people's credit scores after it has been paid off. Read more about our bill here:https://www.hassan.senate.gov/news/press-releases/senator-hassan-joins-in-introducing-legislation-to-help-granite-staters-and-americans-hurt-by-medical-debt …
